originalText.text: I had the 90 minute microdermabrasion treatment with Mary who is an excellent esthetician. Overall I really liked the results of the treatment and would recommend trying it out. However, I didn’t love the facilities which felt somewhat cramped. The women’s changing room was separated from the hallway with a curtain which felt a bit too exposed. I was a bit disappointed not to have been offered a tea or coffee after or before my treatment (though I did have a kombucha and some almonds). There seems to be a bit of inconsistency with the service because my friend who had a treatment at the same time as was offered tea/coffee.

originalText.text:
I will never go to another spa ever again.

This place is too good for words. There is truly nothing like this incredibly decadent experience at La Prarie Spa. As soon as you walk in you are welcomed by an incredibly warm and smiling staff there to make you feel comfortable and wonderfully relaxed. Immediately, you are asked if you want anything (I opted for an almond milk latte - which was baller), and munched on some nuts and dried fruit.

Then I was called by the lovely Rachel to get the caviar mani/pedi treatment. I’ve never been a huge fan of eating caviar, but I am certainly a fan of putting it on my body. The treatment was beautiful! You get to choose your own music, and are whisked away for 2 hours while she transforms your hands, feet and nails into true beauty. My feet have never looked that good.

Afterwards, Rachel took me back to their gorgeous lounge (which they have just recently undergone renovations), where she brought me a crisp glass of bubbly and a few mini desserts to try. I could have died from happiness.

I waited for my nails to dry and then went to use their steam room, showers (their shampoo and conditioner smells delightful), and their beautiful La Prarie products they leave for your use in the locker room. The face wash is top notch.

I think I spent like 4 hours there. Best 4 hours you will ever spend. Real life seems so distant in there while. You leave relaxed, happy and maybe a little tipsy (the champagne is very good lol). Worth every penny. I’m taking my mom next time.

originalText.text: Visiting this Spa was one of my best experiences ever. I got a microdermabrasion facial, and my skin is still feeling baby smooth days later. The esthetician was super attentive and gentle. I feel like the entire staff went the extra mile to make me feel comfortable. Very relaxing. Would recommend this place to anyone.

text.text: Visiting this Spa was one of my best experiences ever. I got a microdermabrasion facial, and my skin is still feeling baby smooth days later. The esthetician was super attentive and gentle. I feel like the entire staff went the extra mile to make me feel comfortable. Very relaxing. Would recommend this place to anyone.

originalText.text: 5 stars. Booked a 90 minute massage with any masseuse and stumbled across Eddie. He made such a difference in my neck/back pain, I ended coming back again before flying home. He was even kind enough to come in early to accommodate my flight time. Highly highly recommend Eddie. Will be booking again when in town.

text.text: 5 stars. Booked a 90 minute massage with any masseuse and stumbled across Eddie. He made such a difference in my neck/back pain, I ended coming back again before flying home. He was even kind enough to come in early to accommodate my flight time. Highly highly recommend Eddie. Will be booking again when in town.

originalText.text: I had an absolutely wonderful, quiet and luxurious experience from start to finish. I booked a 60 min prenatal massage and 90 min signature facial, which were both nothing short of heavenly. Because I’m pregnant, I wasn’t looking for the “total spa experience”, just a top notch treatment-focused escape in a beautiful, clean facility and this was the perfect place for that. When booking, I should have asked if they could do a longer prenatal massage because 60 mins always seems so rushed to me especially if it’s been a while since your last one. Only minor critique is I wish the women’s locker facilities had a bit more privacy than a curtain between it and the relaxation/waiting area though. It seemed easy for anyone to mistakenly walk through it.
